cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest now, forecast to turn north then accelerate NNE across southeastern Louisiana late Wednesday, track inland across AL-GA, then sweep through the Mid-Atlantic and exit off the Delmarva/ New Jersey coast Thursday night.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near Port Fourchon-Mouth of Mississippi River)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast through the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline, including Virginia and the Chesapeake Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with occasional gusts 50 mph) possible Thursday as the core passes inland just west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Virginia coast from Zeta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with localized amounts up to 6 inches, producing flash and urban flooding risks.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat and reduced visibility; possible river/stream rises impacting port logistics.
